Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseballGame, BasketballGame, FootballGame, HockeyGame, SoccerGame
public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This class has a two-argument constructor, two protected abstract methods, 17 protected methods, 4 private final variables, 6 private variables
Author:
Max Finch

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int awayScore
    Keeps track of the away team's score.
    private java.lang.String awayTeam
    Keeps the name of the away team.
    private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> gameLog
    gameLog keeps track of every option made in the game and is replayed at the end of gameLoop() in the ScoreLoop class.

    Keeps track of the home team's score.
    private java.lang.String homeTeam
    Keeps the name of the home team.

    Keeps track of the max allowed period in a game.

    Can be set by a subclass to allow for overtime.

    Keeps track of the current period

    scoringTypes contains the type of scores that can be made in the specified Game.

    Selects the winner based on final period results.

  • Field Details

    • gameLog

      private final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> gameLog
      gameLog keeps track of every option made in the game and is replayed at the end of gameLoop() in the ScoreLoop class. This variable is final because there is no need to reassign the gameLog reference to another ArrayList.

    • scoringTypes

      private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> scoringTypes
      scoringTypes contains the type of scores that can be made in the specified Game. This variable is final because there is no need to reassign the scoringTypes reference to another HashMap.

    • homeTeam

      private final java.lang.String homeTeam
      Keeps the name of the home team. This variable is final because the name of the team should not change mid-game.

    • awayTeam

      private final java.lang.String awayTeam
      Keeps the name of the away team. This variable is final because the name of the team should not change mid-game.

    • homeScore

      private int homeScore
      Keeps track of the home team's score.

    • awayScore

      private int awayScore
      Keeps track of the away team's score.

    • winner

      private java.lang.String winner
      Selects the winner based on final period results. Not final because it would not make sense to declare the winner in the constructor (the beginning of the game).

    • periodNum

      private int periodNum
      Keeps track of the current period

    • maxPeriodNum

      private int maxPeriodNum
      Keeps track of the max allowed period in a game. This variable is not final because subclasses can add an extra period for overtime.

    • overtime

      private boolean overtime
      Can be set by a subclass to allow for overtime.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(java.lang.String homeTeam, java.lang.String awayTeam)
      Two-argument constructor
      Parameters:
      homeTeam - name of homeTeam
      awayTeam - name of awayTeam

  • Method Details

    • selectPlay

      protected abstract void selectPlay​(int selection)
      All subclasses MUST implement this method. It selects the option the scorer selects and updates the game score or period accordingly. See default five games as reference implementations.
      Parameters:
      selection - the type of score or period switch the scorer would like to record.

    • getPeriodOfPlay

      protected abstract java.lang.String getPeriodOfPlay()
      All subclasses MUST implement this method. Although all implementations are the same, the String (period) found in the default subclasses (except for BaseballGame) are final variables. Therefore, we cannot implement getPeriodOfPlay() in the Game class.
      Returns:
      String value signifying the current period of play.

    • gameOverCheck

      protected java.lang.Boolean gameOverCheck()
      This method determines whether the game is over after a selection was made.
      Returns:
      boolean signifying with true/false if the game is over or not.

    • getOvertime

      protected boolean getOvertime()
      This method determines whether the game is allowed to have overtime.
      Returns:
      boolean signifying with true/false if the game gets overtime or not.

    • setOvertime

      protected void setOvertime​(boolean overtime)
      This method allows a subclass to decide whether a game has overtime or not
      Parameters:
      overtime - true/false if the game gets overtime or not.

    • getScoringTypes

      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getScoringTypes()
      This method returns the scoring types (Ex: touchdown, goal, run) of a Game.
      Returns:
      HashMap of a subclass's scoring type where the keys are the string representation for the UI and the values are int number value of the score type.

    • determineWinner

      protected int determineWinner()
      This method determines the winner based on comparing homeScore and awayScore. 1: home team wins 2: away team wins 3: Tie In case of a tie, the result of this method will trigger another period if the game allows overtime.
      Returns:
      int value signifying the final game state.

    • getMaxPeriodNum

      protected int getMaxPeriodNum()
      Gets the max number of periods allowed for the game.
      Returns:
      int value signifying max number of periods.

    • setMaxPeriodNum

      protected void setMaxPeriodNum​(int maxPeriodNum)
      This method allows a subclass to decide how many periods a Game should have.
      Parameters:
      maxPeriodNum - int value signifying max number of periods.

    • getPeriodNum

      protected int getPeriodNum()
      This method gets the current period
      Returns:
      current period number.

    • setPeriodNum

      protected void setPeriodNum​(int periodNum)
      This method allows a subclass to change the current period.
      Parameters:
      periodNum - int value signifying current period number.

    • getGameLog

      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getGameLog()
      This method gets the game log. Subclasses add the score type and period shifts to this ArrayList.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of game history made in a games selectPlay() method.

    • getWinner

      protected java.lang.String getWinner()
      This method gets the winner of the Game.
      Returns:
      the winner or "tie" as a String

    • getHomeTeam

      protected java.lang.String getHomeTeam()
      This method gets the home team's name.
      Returns:
      home team's name.

    • getAwayTeam

      protected java.lang.String getAwayTeam()
      This method gets the away team's name.
      Returns:
      away team's name.

    • getHomeScore

      protected int getHomeScore()
      This method gets the home team's score.
      Returns:
      home team's score.

    • setHomeScore

      protected void setHomeScore​(int homeScore)
      This method sets the home team's score.
      Parameters:
      homeScore - new home team's score.

    • getAwayScore

      protected int getAwayScore()
      This method gets the away team's score.
      Returns:
      away team's score.

    • setAwayScore

      protected void setAwayScore​(int awayScore)
      This method sets the away team's score.
      Parameters:
      awayScore - new away team's score.
